name: treatment of sewage sludge, 70% water, WWT, condensate from light oil boiler, municipal incineration | sewage sludge, 70% water, WWT, condensate from light oil boiler | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25886/documentation

The process represents the treatment of a waste (sewage sludge) that is exclusively produced from another waste treatment. Municipal incineration is the controlled combustion of a waste. Sewage sludge is generated in the wastewater treatment (WWT) of 'condensate from light oil boiler'. Recommended use of this dataset: to be used within the specific chain of treatments for 'condensate from light oil boiler'. Share of biogenic carbon in the sludge: 0%.

The activity starts with the waste being available at the gate of the treatment facility. Collection and transportation of the waste to the treatment plant is not included.

The activity ends with the waste being treated and waste-specific emissions from the incineration process are released to the environment (air and water).
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Modelling parameters affecting the treatment technology are not specific to this geography.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The waste is treated in the incineration plant with flue gas cleaning. Incineration is the controlled combustion of a waste. Auxiliary material consumption for this step of air pollution control (APC) are included in the process. Infrastructure is also included in the process. Air polution control includes, electrostatic precipitator for fly ash (ESP), wet flue gas scrubber and 25% SNCR , 42.77% SCR-high dust , 32.68% SCR-low dust -DeNOx facilities and 0% without DeNOx (weighted according to mass of burnt waste). Efficiency of iron scrap separation from slag : 58%. Efficiency of aluminium scrap separation from slag : 31%. Efficiency of copper scrap separation from slag : 31%. Gross electric efficiency technology mix 15.84% and Gross thermal efficiency technology mix 28.51%
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Modelling parameters are based on an average municipal solid waste incineration plant in Switzerland for the year of 2010 (grate incinerators).
